content.description: Stem off the tree to pre-clip the first bolt. It is funky climbing with mostly good holds. It climbs very similar to the Glory Hole where poor technique can make it much harder than it needs to be. Great place to practice climbing with relaxed arms.
content.location: Semi-separate wall 50' left of the main Treasure Wall formation.

content.description: Three bolts on easy terrain. Then exit right or continue straight towards the anchors with a medium cam. Lots of lichen on the top out. Meh.
content.protection:
Three bolts and a #2 cam. Chains.

Or a solo, you can bail rightward at any time
content.location: East face of the upper tier. Ends next to a prominent dead tree.

content.description: Start behind a large boulder. First bolt is a little high but on moderate terrain. Sustained 5.10 climbing from here to the anchors on slopey sidepulls and incut slots, with the crux coming between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.
content.location: Far right side of the wall.

content.description: This one is all big holds! With good technique, you should be able to breeze through the reaches without too much difficulty. At the third bolt, traverse a few feet left to keep the grade at 5.9. Nice finger and hand jams finish it up to the top.
content.location: Semi-separate wall 50' left of the main Treasure Wall formation.

climbs.name: If I Slip, Then I'm Slippin

content.description:
One of the best routes at LOTL, it begs to be climbed. The rock is clean, smooth and brightly colored. It is more like the climbs down the hill, rather than the bulbous rock at Pinch Me Wall or Sunset Spire. Clip off the log and start back down on the ground. After a long throw to the jug, move left and stay straight on the bolt line. The climbing is exciting from the first move to the last.

The route follows the bolt line closely. Don't cheat yourself by moving way left at the fourth bolt into "Don't Let Me Slip.” Continue through the golden bulge and you'll find the sweet deadpoint crux just right of the bolts.
content.location: to the right of the tree, center of the wall.

content.description: Start as per "Don't Let Me Slip," but at the first bolt (tan) cut left following black bolts on a fun undercling traverse. The crux comes immediately after the traverse with a very tricky sequence. Figure out your feet! Going left around the corner won't help, it's not any easier and will make you run out. Layback up the arete with some fancy footwork while well protected by a bolt. The remainder is typical LOTL 5.9
content.protection: 7-8 bolts. Rap anchor with lower off biners
content.location: Starts right of the tree and traverses left over the bushes.

content.description: Harder left start to If I Slip Then I'm Slippin. If you catch the theme between the two, props to you. This one starts just right of the tree and merges with the other route at the 4th bolt.
content.location: Immediately right of the tree, merges right at the fourth bolt.
